message.content:
To align a row of `div` elements to the right using CSS Flexbox, you can use the `justify-content` property with the value `flex-end`. This will push all items within the container to the far right. Here's an example: ```html Flexbox Align Right
``` In this example, the `.container` element uses `display: flex;` to make its child elements (`.item`) behave as a Flexbox layout. The `justify-content: flex-end;` property is used to align all items inside the container to the right. Each item has some basic styling like width and height set, along with a red background color for visibility. Items are separated by a left margin which creates space between them. You can adjust the properties as needed depending on your layout requirements.
